sen.j: 歳暮（せいぼ）とは、日本において、文字通り年の暮れ、1年の終わりを告げる季語で12月の季語でもある。
sen.e: Seibo is a season word expressing the end of a year as the kanji of seibo means, also it is a season word for December.
Seibo is a season word expressing the end of a year as the kanji of seibo means, also it is a season word for December.

sen.j: 一般には、暮れに世話になった人に対し感謝するなどの歳暮周り（せいぼまわり）と呼ばれる年中行事が行われることが多い。
sen.e: Generally, as an annual event, people make the rounds to offer the thanks to someone about taking care at the end of a year.
Generally, as an annual event, people make the rounds to offer the thanks to someone about taking care at the end of a year.
Generally, as an annual event, people make the rounds to offer thanks to someone at the end of the year for caring about them.

sen.j: このときに贈り物がされるが、この贈答品がお歳暮と呼ばれる。
sen.e: On this occasion, a gift is usually given, which is called as oseibo.

sen.j: 現在では「歳暮」「お歳暮」といった場合、この贈答品、または贈り物の習慣を指すことが一般的である。
sen.e: Present day, "seibo" or "oseibo" generally means this kind of gift or the habit to give it.

sen.j: 本来は直接訪問して贈り物をするものであるが、近年では百貨店などから直送（実際には宅配便のシステムを利用）で相手方に贈られることが多い。
sen.e: Although it is formal to visit and give a gift, in many cases at present day, gifts are sent directly (actually via home delivery service) from shops like department store.

sen.j: 多くの商品が贈答にされる為、この時期の賑わいを歳暮商戦（せいぼしょうせん）、御歳暮商戦（おせいぼしょうせん）などと言う場合もある。
sen.e: As many commercial goods are bought for gifts, the active situation of this period is often called as seibo sales battle at year-end or oseibo sales battle at year-end.

sen.j: この時の贈答品は主に、新しい年を迎える為に必要な物を送ることが多い。
sen.e: As gifts for this case, things needed to get ready for the New Year are usually selected.

sen.j: 具体的にはある程度保存の利くアルコール飲料（ビールやウィスキーなど）、コーヒー、ハム・ソーセージといった食品が多いが、クール便（冷蔵輸送）の拡充によって魚介類や牛肉などの産直生鮮食品も利用される。
sen.e: For example, preservable foods such as alcoholic drinks (beer or whiskey), coffee, ham, and sausage are usually preferred, but also fresh food such as sea foods and beef are used as cool transportation has grown.

sen.j: また、洗剤や石鹸など、生活必需品を贈ることも一般的である。
sen.e: It is also common to give necessities of life such as detergent and soap.

sen.j: また、相手先が商品の選択を可能とする目的で、商品券や引換券を贈る場合もある。
sen.e: As an alternative to allow the receiver to select goods, gift certificates or gift coupons are given.
Gift certificates or gift coupons which let receivers choose what they want are sometimes sent as an alternative.

sen.j: この時期に贈る品物には紅白の水引と、熨斗アワビの飾りまたは代わりのマークを付けて贈る（ただし、品物が生ものの場合は熨斗アワビは付けずに水引のみ）。
sen.e: The gift of this period is decorated with a red and white colored mizuhiki (decorative Japanese cord made from twisted paper) and a long, thin strip of dried abalone (or a mark instead of abalone,) while only a mizuhiki is attached but an abalone is not attached if the gift is fresh food.

sen.j: 日本では、取引先の企業の担当者、その上席、担当役員などにお歳暮を贈る習慣が広く存在する。
sen.e: In Japan, a habit to give seibo to the contact personnel, its superior or director in charge of counterparty companies is spread widely.
In Japan, a custom to give seibo to the contact personnel, its superiors or directors in charge of counterparty companies is spread widely.
In Japan, the custom to give seibo to the associates personnel, superiors or directors in charge of associate companies has spread widely.

sen.j: 毎年12月中旬頃から下旬にかけ、企業から企業への贈答、また得意先幹部同士の贈答が、また社員同士の贈答が広く行われる。
sen.e: Every year, from middle to end of December, gifts between companies, between managers of counterparty companies, and between employee are made generally.
Every year, from the middle to end of December, gifts between companies, between managers of counterparty companies, and between employees are made generally.
Every year, from the middle to the end of December, gifts between companies, between managers of associate companies, and between employees are generally given.

sen.j: 1990年代頃までは、大手企業を中心に、取引先や監督官庁職員の自宅住所のリストを作成し歳暮贈答を行うことがあった。
sen.e: Until 1990's, big enterprises used to make list of personnel of counterparty companies and regulatory agencies and to give them seibo gifts.
Until the 1990's, big enterprises used to make list of personnel of counterparty companies and regulatory agencies and to give them seibo gifts.
Until the 1990's, big enterprises used to make a list of personnel of associate companies and regulatory agencies and to give them seibo gifts.

sen.j: 現在では、公務員が許認可等の相手方、立入検査等の相手方、契約の相手方などの利害関係者から、お歳暮などの金銭・物品を受け取ることが禁じられている（国家公務員倫理規程第3条第1項）。
sen.e: Now, it is prohibited for public employee to receive money or goods as oseibo or other from stakeholders such as the other party of approval and license, on-site inspection, and contract (National Public Service Ethics Code, Article 3, Paragraph 1.)

Now, it is prohibited for public employees to receive money or goods as oseibo or other from stakeholders such as the other party of approval and license, on-site inspection, and contract (the National Public Service Ethics Code, Article 3, Paragraph 1.)

Now, it is prohibited for public employees to receive money or goods as oseibo or other gifts from others who seek approvals and licenses, on-site inspections, and contracts (the National Public Service Ethics Code, Article 3, Paragraph 1.)

sen.j: 民間企業では法令で規制・禁止されているわけではないが、バブル崩壊後の虚礼見直しや企業活動のコンプライアンス確保のため、企業方針として高額の贈答品の受け取りを辞退する企業が多くなってきている。
sen.e: Although it is not prohibited for private businesses, increasing number of companies have decided as the company's policy to refuse to receive expensive gifts as an action to readjust empty formalities after the bubble economy burst or to ensure compliance of business activity.

Although it is not prohibited for private businesses, an increasing number of companies have decided as company policy to refuse expensive gifts as an action to readjust empty formalities after the burst of the bubble economy or to ensure ongoing compliance of business activities.

sen.j: さらには、2000年代以降の個人情報保護の社会的動きや、取引先と社員の癒着の防止の観点から、取引先企業から各社員自宅への贈答品を規制する動きもある。
sen.e: Moreover, to comply with the social tendency of private information protection arose from 2000's, and to prevent collusion between the counterparty company and the employee, it has begun to restrict gifts from counterparty company to home of employee.
